00034 /** @file decl.cpp
00035     @brief Implementations of classes related to turning declarations into 
00036            symbols and types.

00049 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00050 // DeclSpecs
00051 
00052 DeclSpecs::DeclSpecs(const Type *t, StorageClass sc, int tq) {
00053     baseType = t;
00054     storageClass = sc;
00055     typeQualifier = tq;
00056     soaWidth = 0;
00057     vectorSize = 0;
00058 }
00059 
00060 
00061 void
00062 DeclSpecs::Print() const {
00063     if (storageClass == SC_EXTERN)   printf("extern ");
00064     if (storageClass == SC_EXTERN_C) printf("extern \"C\" ");
00065     if (storageClass == SC_EXPORT)   printf("export ");
00066     if (storageClass == SC_STATIC)   printf("static ");
00067     if (storageClass == SC_TYPEDEF)  printf("typedef ");
00068 
00069     if (soaWidth > 0) printf("soa<%d> ", soaWidth);
00070 
00071     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_INLINE)    printf("inline ");
00072     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_CONST)     printf("const ");
00073     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM)   printf("uniform ");
00074     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_VARYING)   printf("varying ");
00075     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_TASK)      printf("task ");
00076     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_REFERENCE) printf("reference ");
00077     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_UNSIGNED)  printf("unsigned ");
00078 
00079     printf("%s", baseType->GetString().c_str());
00080 
00081     if (vectorSize > 0) printf("<%d>", vectorSize);
00082 }

00087 
00088 Declarator::Declarator(Symbol *s, SourcePos p) 
00089   : pos(p) { 
00090     sym = s;
00091     functionArgs = NULL;
00092     isFunction = false;
00093     initExpr = NULL;
00094 }

00096 
00097 void
00098 Declarator::AddArrayDimension(int size) {
00099     assert(size > 0 || size == -1); // -1 -> unsized
00100     arraySize.push_back(size);
00101 }

00103 
00104 void
00105 Declarator::InitFromDeclSpecs(DeclSpecs *ds) {
00106     sym->type = GetType(ds);
00107     sym->storageClass = ds->storageClass;
00108 }

00110 
00111 void
00112 Declarator::Print() const {
00113     printf("%s", sym->name.c_str());
00114     if (initExpr != NULL) {
00115         printf(" = (");
00116         initExpr->Print();
00117         printf(")");
00118     }
00119     pos.Print();
00120 }

00122 
00123 void
00124 Declarator::GetFunctionInfo(DeclSpecs *ds, Symbol **funSym, 
00125                             std::vector<Symbol *> *funArgs) {
00126     // Get the symbol for the function from the symbol table.  (It should
00127     // already have been added to the symbol table by AddGlobal() by the
00128     // time we get here.)
00129     const FunctionType *type = 
00130         dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(GetType(ds));
00131     assert(type != NULL);
00132     *funSym = m->symbolTable->LookupFunction(sym->name.c_str(), type);
00133     if (*funSym != NULL)
00134         // May be NULL due to error earlier in compilation
00135         (*funSym)->pos = pos;
00136 
00137     if (functionArgs != NULL) {
00138         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < functionArgs->size(); ++i) {
00139             Declaration *pdecl = (*functionArgs)[i];
00140             assert(pdecl->declarators.size() == 1);
00141             funArgs->push_back(pdecl->declarators[0]->sym);
00142         }
00143     }
00144 }
00145 
00146 
00147 static const Type *
00148 lGetType(const Declarator *decl, DeclSpecs *ds, 
00149          std::vector<int>::const_iterator arrayIter) {
00150     if (arrayIter == decl->arraySize.end()) {
00151         // If we don't have an array (or have processed all of the array
00152         // dimensions in previous recursive calls), we can go ahead and
00153         // figure out the final non-array type we have here.
00154         const Type *type = ds->baseType;
00155         if (type == NULL) {
00156             Error(decl->pos, "Type not provided in variable declaration for variable \"%s\".",
00157                   decl->sym->name.c_str());
00158             return NULL;
00159         }
00160 
00161         // Account for 'unsigned' and 'const' qualifiers in the type
00162         if ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_UNSIGNED) != 0) {
00163             const Type *unsignedType = type->GetAsUnsignedType();
00164             if (unsignedType != NULL)
00165                 type = unsignedType;
00166             else
00167                 Error(decl->pos, "\"unsigned\" qualifier is illegal with \"%s\" type.",
00168                       type->GetString().c_str());
00169         }
00170         if ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_CONST) != 0)
00171             type = type->GetAsConstType();
00172 
00173         if (ds->vectorSize > 0) {
00174             const AtomicType *atomicType = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type);
00175             if (atomicType == NULL) {
00176                 Error(decl->pos, "Only atomic types (int, float, ...) are legal for vector "
00177                       "types.");
00178                 return NULL;
00179             }
00180             type = new VectorType(atomicType, ds->vectorSize);
00181         }
00182 
00183         // if uniform/varying is specified explicitly, then go with that
00184         if ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM) != 0)
00185             return type->GetAsUniformType();
00186         else if ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_VARYING) != 0)
00187             return type->GetAsVaryingType();
00188         else {
00189             // otherwise, structs are uniform by default and everything
00190             // else is varying by default
00191             if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type) != NULL)
00192                 return type->GetAsUniformType();
00193             else
00194                 return type->GetAsVaryingType();
00195         }
00196     }
00197     else {
00198         // Peel off one dimension of the array
00199         int arraySize = *arrayIter;
00200         ++arrayIter;
00201 
00202         // Get the type, not including the arraySize dimension peeled off
00203         // above.
00204         const Type *childType = lGetType(decl, ds, arrayIter);
00205 
00206         int soaWidth = ds->soaWidth;
00207         if (soaWidth == 0)
00208             // If there's no "soa<n>" stuff going on, just return a regular
00209             // array with the appropriate size 
00210             return new ArrayType(childType, arraySize == -1 ? 0 : arraySize);
00211        else {
00212             // Make sure we actually have an array of structs ..
00213             const StructType *childStructType = 
00214                 dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(childType);
00215             if (childStructType == NULL) {
00216                 Error(decl->pos, "Illegal to provide soa<%d> qualifier with non-struct "
00217                       "type \"%s\".", soaWidth, childType->GetString().c_str());
00218                 return new ArrayType(childType, arraySize == -1 ? 0 : arraySize);
00219             }
00220             else if ((soaWidth & (soaWidth - 1)) != 0) {
00221                 Error(decl->pos, "soa<%d> width illegal.  Value must be power of two.",
00222                       soaWidth);
00223                 return NULL;
00224             }
00225             else if (arraySize != -1 && (arraySize % soaWidth) != 0) {
00226                 Error(decl->pos, "soa<%d> width must evenly divide array size %d.",
00227                       soaWidth, arraySize);
00228                 return NULL;
00229             }
00230             return new SOAArrayType(childStructType, arraySize == -1 ? 0 : arraySize,
00231                                     soaWidth);
00232         }
00233     }
00234 }
00235 
00236 
00237 const Type *
00238 Declarator::GetType(DeclSpecs *ds) const {
00239     bool hasUniformQual = ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM) != 0);
00240     bool hasVaryingQual = ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_VARYING) != 0);
00241     bool isTask =         ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_TASK) != 0);
00242     bool isReference =    ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_REFERENCE) != 0);
00243 
00244     if (hasUniformQual && hasVaryingQual) {
00245         Error(pos, "Can't provide both \"uniform\" and \"varying\" qualifiers.");
00246         return NULL;
00247     }
00248 
00249     if (isFunction) {
00250         std::vector<const Type *> args;
00251         std::vector<std::string> argNames;
00252         if (functionArgs) {
00253             // Loop over the function arguments and get names and types for
00254             // each one in the args and argNames arrays
00255             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < functionArgs->size(); ++i) {
00256                 Declaration *d = (*functionArgs)[i];
00257                 Symbol *sym;
00258                 if (d->declarators.size() == 0) {
00259                     // function declaration like foo(float), w/o a name for
00260                     // the parameter
00261                     char buf[32];
00262                     sprintf(buf, "__anon_parameter_%d", i);
00263                     sym = new Symbol(buf, pos);
00264                     Declarator *declarator = new Declarator(sym, sym->pos);
00265                     sym->type = declarator->GetType(d->declSpecs);
00266                     d->declarators.push_back(declarator);
00267                 }
00268                 else {
00269                     assert(d->declarators.size() == 1);
00270                     sym = d->declarators[0]->sym;
00271                 }
00272 
00273                 // Arrays are passed by reference, so convert array
00274                 // parameters to be references here.
00275                 if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(sym->type) != NULL)
00276                     sym->type = new ReferenceType(sym->type, sym->type->IsConstType());
00277 
00278                 args.push_back(sym->type);
00279                 argNames.push_back(sym->name);
00280             }
00281         }
00282 
00283         if (ds->baseType == NULL) {
00284             Warning(pos, "No return type provided in declaration of function \"%s\". "
00285                     "Treating as \"void\".", sym->name.c_str());
00286             ds->baseType = AtomicType::Void;
00287         }
00288 
00289         if (isReference) {
00290             Error(pos, "Function return types can't be reference types.");
00291             return NULL;
00292         }
00293 
00294         const Type *returnType = lGetType(this, ds, arraySize.begin());
00295         if (returnType == NULL)
00296             return NULL;
00297 
00298         bool isExported = (ds->storageClass == SC_EXPORT);
00299         bool isExternC =  (ds->storageClass == SC_EXTERN_C);
00300         return new FunctionType(returnType, args, pos, &argNames, isTask, 
00301                                 isExported, isExternC);
00302     }
00303     else {
00304         if (isTask)
00305             Error(pos, "\"task\" qualifier illegal in variable declaration \"%s\".",
00306                   sym->name.c_str());
00307 
00308         const Type *type = lGetType(this, ds, arraySize.begin());
00309 
00310         if (type != NULL && isReference) {
00311             bool hasConstQual = ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_CONST) != 0);
00312             type = new ReferenceType(type, hasConstQual);
00313         }
00314 
00315         return type;
00316     }
00317 }
00318 
00319 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00320 // Declaration
00321 
00322 Declaration::Declaration(DeclSpecs *ds, std::vector<Declarator *> *dlist) {
00323     declSpecs = ds;
00324     if (dlist != NULL)
00325         declarators = *dlist;
00326     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declarators.size(); ++i)
00327         if (declarators[i] != NULL)
00328             declarators[i]->InitFromDeclSpecs(declSpecs);
00329 }
00330 
00331 
00332 Declaration::Declaration(DeclSpecs *ds, Declarator *d) {
00333     declSpecs = ds;
00334     if (d) {
00335         d->InitFromDeclSpecs(ds);
00336         declarators.push_back(d);
00337     }
00338 }
00339 
00340 
00341 std::vector<VariableDeclaration>
00342 Declaration::GetVariableDeclarations() const {
00343     assert(declSpecs->storageClass != SC_TYPEDEF);
00344     std::vector<VariableDeclaration> vars;
00345 
00346     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declarators.size(); ++i) {
00347         if (declarators[i] == NULL)
00348             continue;
00349         Declarator *decl = declarators[i];
00350         if (!decl || decl->isFunction) 
00351             continue;
00352 
00353         m->symbolTable->AddVariable(declarators[i]->sym);
00354 
00355         vars.push_back(VariableDeclaration(declarators[i]->sym,
00356                                            declarators[i]->initExpr));
00357     }
00358     return vars;
00359 }
00360 
00361 
00362 void
00363 Declaration::Print() const {
00364     printf("Declaration: specs [");
00365     declSpecs->Print();
00366     printf("], declarators [");
00367     for (unsigned int i = 0 ; i < declarators.size(); ++i) {
00368         declarators[i]->Print();
00369         printf("%s", (i == declarators.size() - 1) ? "]" : ", ");
00370     }
00371 }

00373 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00374 
00375 void
00376 GetStructTypesNamesPositions(const std::vector<StructDeclaration *> &sd,
00377                              std::vector<const Type *> *elementTypes,
00378                              std::vector<std::string> *elementNames,
00379                              std::vector<SourcePos> *elementPositions) {
00380     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < sd.size(); ++i) {
00381         const Type *type = sd[i]->type;
00382         // FIXME: making this fake little DeclSpecs here is really
00383         // disgusting
00384         DeclSpecs ds(type);
00385         if (type->IsUniformType()) 
00386             ds.typeQualifier |= TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM;
00387         else
00388             ds.typeQualifier |= TYPEQUAL_VARYING;
00389 
00390         for (unsigned int j = 0; j < sd[i]->declarators->size(); ++j) {
00391             Declarator *d = (*sd[i]->declarators)[j];
00392             d->InitFromDeclSpecs(&ds);
00393 
00394             // if it's an unsized array, make it a reference to an unsized
00395             // array, so the caller can pass a pointer...
00396             const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(d->sym->type);
00397             if (at && at->GetElementCount() == 0)
00398                 d->sym->type = new ReferenceType(d->sym->type, type->IsConstType());
00399 
00400             elementTypes->push_back(d->sym->type);
00401             elementNames->push_back(d->sym->name);
00402             elementPositions->push_back(d->sym->pos);
00403         }
00404     }
00405 }
